Name: moisture surge 100h auto-replenishing hydrator moisturizer
comments:
* I LOVE this product. I dont know what I would do without her!! I am 21 years old, I have skin that is easily allergic to a lot of products, and have rosacea. I also get extremely dry skin year round that cracks and starts to burn. I have tried lathering myself in aquaphor and many different moisturizers but nothing works like this product. I put her on and she is ready to put makeup over in less than 3 minutes, and she doesn't cause my makeup to pill, which I love because both this moisturizer and my bb cream are water based. On my no makeup days, I only need to apply her once in the morning, and in the past I would need to reapply moisturizers almost 3 times a day. Like I mentioned above, I struggle with redness in the cheek area from rosacea and have noticed that going down signifigantly since I started using this product. It is so calming, hydrating, easy to use, and really lives up to its name. The only con is how expensive it is but it is definently worth it to claim any sales going on to give her a try! 
I don't know how my skin lived before this product!! * It's a nice gel moisturizer, but not as moisturizing as I need for a "senior". * I think it works and it doesn't clog the pores. I have combination skin that is prone to being oily, and the only other moisturizer that worked so far was from Purito brand. It is worth it if your skin isn't overly dry and if you're scared of breaking out. * On melanated skin often times moisturizers with spf leave a residue. This does not. Doesn't feel heavy on the skin. * Indoor heat has been a real threat to my skin. I knew i needed to change to something more creamy and absorbent. This was recommended to me and I'm so pleased with the results. It's not greasy, absorbs quickly, and helps my foundation stay fresh all day. You need ti try some tiday. You won't be sorry. * I was looking for a good moisturizer and this one was part of Ulta's January sale. It feels good on my skin and I'm

Name: protini polypeptide firming moisturizer
comments:
* I was reluctant to buy drunk elephant at first because of the price. Curiosity won me over and i bought the travel set. 

I love this moisturizer! I have already restocked this in the fullsize! It is worth the price. My skin is hydrated, and clear! * I have used Protini Polypeptide for a couple of years and my skin is smoother and more lifted.  I have rosacea and this product is wonderful for sensitive skin! * Love this product. Noticed a difference in the hydration of my skin. My skin is definitely smoother. * I've gone through at least 5 regular containers and 2-3 minis in the last four years. It has become a go to product. It feels moisturizing even when I use strong cleansers, and I feel it improves the texture of my skin. * I have been using for over 5 years. I have tried a few other brands, but always come back to this one. I have senstive skin and this is one of the only mositruizers that has worked for me. 

My one complaint is with the refills. I have  had issues with fit and functioning of the original container. After replacing lotion, the dispenser stopped working. * I have been using this for a little over a month now. The PROS‚Ä¶ It feels amazing on my skin. My skin feels silky, soft and it feels incredibly hydrated. It also wears very well underneath makeup. The CONS‚Ä¶ it advertises that it helps with the appearance of skin tone, texture, and firmness. I have not noticed any difference in any of thsoe areas. CONCLUSION ‚Ä¶ if you're looking for a hydrating moisturizer that feels wonderful on your skin and works well with sensitive skin, this is a wonderful moisturizer for you. If you're looking for the benefits of improved tone, texture, and firmness, like it advertises, I would not recommend this moistureizer. * USE WITH CAUTION! 
I recently ordered a new one late October. For reference my last Protini was purchased July 2025.
I have no idea what happened but within hours of application my face became red, I woke up the next day and had small milia/whiteheads, all over my face and neck along with a lovely rash. Stopped using it immediately, reached out to the company to confirm any formula changes, to which they said there was none.
Returned the product but am still wondering what happened as I have been using this particular cream for years and never had an issue. 
If you plan to start using this cream or even get a new one, start using it when you have no important events coming up, just in case you have a reaction.

Looking back at the date I started using this product "THE RICH CREAM" and doing the math I realized that this product causes rosacea-like symptoms. I was even flushing and sensitive to heat. Expose to the sun with this cream on was cooking my skin. Yes, I'm beating myself up, because I was actually thinking the whole time that this cream was helping me keep my skin moisturized at least. 

Here is the tricky part: not all my face broke out, felt hot or uncomfortable. My forehead, chin and nose were normal and moisturized by this cream. 

All symptoms were strong on the apple of the cheek (malar fat pad). Therefore, my dermatologist told me it was just rosacea.

Another tricky part; I didn't feel any stinging or burning immediately after applying. The symptoms were triggered with heat and moist.

Name: countercontrol matte effect gel cream
comments:
* If you truly have oily skin, you know the difference in a review from someone with oily skin vs someone whos skin gets oily.  I have oily skin and probably spend upwards of $1K a year on products trying to find things that actually do as they claim, and this is one of them.

I was a little reluctant to purchase this as the price is pretty high for a brand I've never used, but I'm glad that I took the risk on it.  Prior to this moisturizer I was either using none at all (because most others just make me more oily, dont need redundant products on oily skin), or I was using the La-Roche Posay Toleriane Double Repair Matte one which didn't do much for me. Obviously how this will work for you is going to be different for everyone, and the other products you use prior to your moisturizer will make a difference as well.

For reference I am a 28 yr old female, white/Caucasian.  My morning routine is: wash with a clay based cleanser (Dermalogica), tone (Fenty Skin), hyperpigmentation serum (Good Molecules), niacinamide/zinc serum (Sunday Riley), then this moisturizer. The consistency of this product is great for oil as it is a gel based product, but it comes out more opaque white than clear which is fine. It does not have much of a fragrance that I have noticed, but I'm not sensitive to fragrance so I wouldn't be one to say. When I put this on it almost feels as if it is a crossover between a moisturizer and a makeup primer that blurs your pores.  Now it does not make your pores go away by any means, but it does HELP.  Immediately after applying my skin is definitely mattified but again, not completely shine free as if it is a primer with the sole purpose of making your skin look like it has powder on it. It does not make my skin feel tight and dried out, it genuinely makes me feel moisturized and smooth without the glowy look that normal moisturizers do. From my experience it definitely does not keep me matte for 8 hours, I would say after about 3-4 hours I start to see shine on my face to the point where I feel the need to blot if I were going out somewhere (this is all without wearing makeup or anything on top of my morning skin routine, I work from home).

If you truly have an oily/combo skin type this is not going to be your holy-grail product that makes all of your problems disappear (will continue to search for it), but if it is within your budget for a product of this type then this is 100% top 5 best moisturizers for oily skin on the market right now in my opinion after having used this for a few weeks now.  Would repurchase (and I rarely ever find products I do)!  

I also just want to throw out there that I did buy this on my own, was not asked/paid to write this, and I think this is either my only review I've ever written on Ulta or one of a few over a span of years that I don't even remember. * The packaging is very luxe but the pump feels like its empty and its still half full. It doesn't mattify anything but it is a nice mix of a gel and lotion and a lightweight moisturizer. This is an MLM and I do feel it's overpriced for what it is. I have not witnessed brightening or firming. A big selling point (and likely excuse for the huge price tag) is the Grand Rose extract, which Lanc√¥me does a poor job explaining the benefit of. Luckily I had Ulta points to use on this cream, and not my own money. I got roped into the illusion of grandeur and prestige with this Absolue cream. Don't be like me. The texture of the product was nice, and there was no scent, which I appreciated, but it just didn't work for me. * This has definitely calmed my rosacea flare at a fraction of the cost for products at the dermatologist and it fits in perfectly with my skin care routine

Name: clinique smart clinical repair wrinkle correcting rich face cream
comments:
* Used entire jar, as recommended. Saw zero difference. So sad. * It may not help the lines and aging affects on my fqc3 but the cream makes my face feel smooth, youthful and healthy. It may not be so but it feels good * I thought this was a great product and that the flushing on the neck and breakouts on the apple of my cheeks was due to rosacea. Nope. It was this cream. Under the sun with this cream it is even worse. 
Tricky part: not all my face was burning nor breaking out. And burning is not immediately after applying!
I stopped using this cream and my face is on its way to recovery. 
So, be aware. I read another comment stating kind of the same situation. I was actually going to reoder, but was curious about the 1 star reviews and finding "that especific comment" put an end to my nightmare. * I was going to reorder this product, but I was curious about the 1 star reviews and someone mentioned experiencing the same issues as me. 
Looking back at the date I started using this product "THE RICH CREAM" and doing the math I realized that this product causes rosacea-like symptoms. I was even flushing and sensitive to heat. Expose to the sun with this cream on was cooking my skin. Yes, I'm beating myself up, because I was actually thinking the whole time that this cream was helping me keep my skin moisturized at least. 

Here is the tricky part: not all my face broke out, felt hot or uncomfortable. My forehead, chin and nose were normal and moisturized by this cream. 

All symptoms were strong on the apple of the cheek (malar fat pad). Therefore, my dermatologist told me it was just rosacea.

Another tricky part; I didn't feel any stinging or burning immediately after applying. The symptoms were triggered with heat and moist. 

I can reasurre that the issue was this cream. I put it to test. 
I rarely leave reviews these days, but this whole situation was a nightmare to me and I hope I can help others. * One of my favorite products! * Light & fluffy ! Name: mela b3 uv daily moisturizer sunscreen, spf 30
comments:
* I don't review much, but this one deserves it. I've tried probably 30-40 kinds of sunscreen via samples and full-blown purchases. Everyone's sunscreen preferences are different, but this one is my absolute Holy Grail.

So far I've gone through four tubes, and I've gotten two family members to start using it.

To be fair, I can't quite tell if it has done *most* of the heavy lifting for my post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation as I use a lot of other actives (like forms of retinol, vitamin C, etc), but I used to have horrible cystic acne outbreaks for years (stopped months ago due to nutritional changes), and the dark spots are shockingly barely noticeable -- I'm POSITIVE this has helped amongst other factors because I used to end up with scabs from cystic acne heads that were so large and painful, I was convinced they'd ruin my skin forever. This also has niacinamide at 10% and the Melasyl-- I know this product has been a crucial component to get my skin tone even again. Keep in mind, it's a long-term game. Results don't happen overnight.

Best aspect about this sunscreen? It's application. The texture is smooth, perfect balance between viscous liquid gel and an ultra light, easily-blended moisturizer. NOT heavy nor thick. I don't "feel" it on my skin. I've used it under make-up of course, but it's actually been on non-make-up days that I've had several coworkers comment on my skin being "glowing" when just wearing this sunscreen alone (almost acting like a primer/face base). It seriously gives your face a subtle glow that's not from shimmer or mica. Also has a subtle scent I like very much (exact same scent as La Roche Posay's Mela B3 serum which I've just tried for first time).

I've run out and been forcing myself to use other sunscreens I've purchased or free samples I've received... tried everything from mineral sunscreens, K-beauty brands, Supergoop, Shieseido ($),  Naked Sundays, Kinship, Lancome, Vacation, Elf, Live Tinted, Coola... and frankly this is the best one for an SPF-30 rated sunscreen for me above them all.

Sometimes I do need SPF 50 for summer days so I do have to switch it out due to UV index, but this is my first choice undoubtedly when the SPF 30 sun protection is enough. * This product made my face burn . It was red for three days and had a horrible burning sensation. Now I have stronger spots and oily pimples, like acne. The worst part is that I ordered the mela serum, as soon as I receive it I will have to return it, I love this brand but this product did not work for me. * I used this product for 3 days and was not outside.  On the 4th day I discovered a rash on my face, almost like small blisters under the skin.  It appeared in the exact spots where I applied the cream. I immediately stopped. Five days later my face is beginning to clear. * I have oily skin so hard to find a good sunscreen.  This leaves my skin nice, no breakouts, and hoping it lightens my melasma. Haven't been using long enough to really tell. I like it though! * This product disappointed me. I tried it for about a week, and I woke up to three new acne spots, which was strange because the website claims it is non-comedogenic. However, when I looked into the ingredients, I was disheartened to find that it contains shea butter, which can clog pores, especially for those with oily skin. I really wanted to love it, but unfortunately, I can't. * AVOID WEARING UNDER MAKEUP - PILLING 
I always wear makeup under foundation/concealer and i usually keep my base routine super simple (e.g. water-based serum plus sunscreen). I applied this sunscreen under my makeup twice already and both times my foundation pilled and separated. I applied the foundation using a puff sponge. Now, I will only apply this sunscreen on no makeup days and will use as a hand sunscreen as well. * I love it

Name: water drench hyaluronic cloud rich barrier moisturizer

It is fantastic for dry or dehydrated skin, it's a very dense and creamy texture, but when you warm it up with your fingers it melts well into the skin. I personally really like it. I don't typically go for expensive moisturizers but this is definitely one of the few that I think gives a very lush yet hydrated feel to the skin. My skin stays soft hours and hours after applying, the overall feel is amazing. With anyone who struggles with dry, flaky skin this is a miracle worker. But you have to stay consistent. One jar lasts me almost 6 months, only a dime size is needed, two if it is particularly dry. Amazing product, so I recommend to bite the bullet when it comes to the price and give it a try. * I have dry skin and this is the most relieving and hydrating product ive tried. Found it through a free sample and had to get it. Love barriers but this is the best. Wow, my new HG üíØ I put it on at night after actives and I can totally see & feel the difference in the morning. I'm 39, living in hot & arid AZ with an extremely oily T zone and insanely dry outer perimeter of my face. Not gonna lie, it leaves your face greasy but with visible results in the morning!!!! I've tried numerous thick moisturizers and nothing works like this one! Hydrated and doesn't break me out either. I use the OG cream in the morning & rich cream at night ‚ù§Ô∏è Please don't ever stop making these creams! * I never used to use a hydrator expecting that my moisturizer would do the job but after 40, my skin kept getting drier and no matter how much expensive moisturizer I used, it never felt hydrated. comments: * Maybe it was the ginzing. I love this. Put in in your PR * This is my new favorote SPF for my face. It absorbs quickly into the skin, does a great job protecting my skin from the sun, and smells divine. I have even worn it under makeup without any issues. * Great face lotion with spf. Lotion with spf that does not have a white cast on the skin. I love it and gives a great glow to the face * I received this sunscreen after attending their promotional walk for the launch of the product. I noticed the very next day I started getting micro bumps that resembled milia or granulomatous. I stopped wearing make up and switched to a gentle cleanser to see if those were the reasons however I remained applying the sunscreen to obviously help protect my face. To my surprise, my skin was only getting worse. It was starting to burn and itch. I've been allergy tested, and I don't have any. The day I didn't use the sunscreen, my skin condition immediately disappeared, so I went to look at the ingredients list. I don't know if Origins is using the oils from grapefruit, lemon and orange for fragrance purposes, but it does not list anywhere that they have extracted the furanocoumarins. After meeting with my dermatologist, I was advised that the citrus oils used in the sunscreen caused photosensitivity, and burned/ irritated my skin. If you are someone with darker or sensitive skin, I HIGHLY recommend AVOIDING this.

It was pretty instant, at the end of the day the bumps were the worst and I would wash my face and wake up to no bumps (not what happens with typical acne). If you haven't heard of acne cosmetica, google it that way you can watch out for it with this product or any others. Name: green apple age defy moisturizer

comments:
* Seriously, the greatest of all time. I have dry, sensitive skin that's prone to rosacea and this has been a life saver. It's gentle and leaves my skin feeling soft, smooth and soothed. It's an added bonus that it smells delicious. * This is a great product for my dry, sensitive, and maturing skin. I more than likely will not purchase again. Bought 3 times before yall went and raised the price by $14. Not worth the price IMO. I feel there are better products for that price point. * I got this to keep my face from getting dry this winter. It works very well so far. The only thing I question is the fragrance, which is delightful, but probably not so good for my skin. * I wanted to love this product! The smell/texture is lovely.

Unfortunately, while sporting a "clean ingredients" tag and a tag from the national eczema association, I found the product to be highly irritating when I had a flare up. I only used it once during that time, and then after taking a second look at the ingredients, I found out that "phenoxyethanol" is a known potential allergen, irritant, potential endocrine disruptor, and the manufacturing process is highly polluting. In other countries the "safe" threshold for this ingredient is 1%, but it's hard to determine how much one is exposed to if applying daily/multiple times a day. Of course, there is no such regulation in US, so who knows how much is in this cream. 

At the same time I bought this, I tried products from cocokind which I highly recommend! They have a great price point and really are "clean" from what I have used so far, although one should always do their own research. While I was still having an eczema episode, I found using a homemade oatmeal paste + cocokind's chia seed oil was very helpful to get me through the dry itchiness. 

TLDR: not a clean product, could be irritating, check out cocokind. * I've been being treated for cancer for about a year and a half, now. Almost 6 months of that has been chemotherapy. Most products cause acne and rashes on my skin, since being on treatment. 
Pros: Did not irritate my overly sensitive skin. Smells good. I don't understand all the complaints about the smell. It is light and nice. It is kind of like marshmallows, but better. 

Cons: it moisturizes, but not enough while going through chemo. It feels great when I first put it on. But, after a few hours my skin feels tight again. Kind of like how vaseline can trick you into thinking your skin is moisturized at first. Hours later the surface of your skin feels tight and dry like a sunburn ready to peel. 

For the price, thete are much better options. Philosophy moisturizers are a lottle cheaper and give better longer lasting results for me in terms of moisture. * This is my 3rd time repurchasing this moisturizer. Unreal/ must try! * I do not want my face smelling like vanilla frosting but it did the whole time I used this. My fault but I'd literally have to hold my breath
